title: Introduction: The Whole Earth Network, Organic Cybernetics, and the Problem with Intelligence
description: An introduction to the Cybernetic Countercultures and the core concepts of organic cybernetics. Exploring the distinction between cognition and intelligence.

readings.name: Clarke, “The Whole Earth Network,” in Gaian Systems, chapter 4
Roli, Jaeger, and Kauffman, “How Organisms Come to Know the World: Fundamental Limits on Artificial General Intelligence

links.name: “Understanding Whole Systems” in each Whole Earth Catalog and CoEvolution Quarterly

title: Organism and Artifact: Norbert Wiener
description: Organic cybernetics and the mechanistic worldview. Physics envy, feedback, and the reversal of Descartes.

readings.name: Canguilhem, “Machine and Organism”
Wiener, The Human Use of Human Beings

materials.name: Rosenblueth, Wiener, and Bigelow, “Behavior, Purpose and Teleology”

title: Approaching Autopoiesis: Maturana and Varela
description: Living systems: the genesis and early journey of the concept of autopoiesis. From Santiago to the Cybernetic Countercultures.

readings.name: Varela, “The Early Days of Autopoiesis”
Maturana and Varela, Autopoiesis and Cognition
Maturana and Varela, The Tree of Knowledge: The Biological Roots of Human Understanding, 2nd ed.
Stephen Nachmanovitch, 'All About Frogs' from The Art of Is: Improvising as a Way of Life

materials.name: Varela, Maturana, and Uribe, “Autopoiesis: The Organization of Living Systems”

title: Ecology of Mind: Gregory Bateson
description: Gregory Bateson’s nomadic trail to the Cybernetic Countercultures. Rethinking cybernetics and information theory through ecology.

readings.name: Stewart Brand, “For God’s Sake, Margaret: Conversation with Gregory Bateson and Margaret Mead,” CoEvolution Quarterly 10 (Summer 1976): 32-44.
Guddemi, Gregory Bateson and Relational Communication
Herbert, “The Ecology of Dune”
Nachmanovitch, “Being Whole”

materials.name: Bateson, Steps to an Ecology of Mind, selections: “Cybernetic Explanation,” “Effects of Conscious Purpose on Human Adaptation,” and “Form, Substance and Difference”

title: Epistemological Constructivism: Heinz von Foerster
description: From information to cognition: von Foerster’s journey from self-organizing systems to Laws of Form

readings.name: Clarke, “Heinz von Foerster’s Demons”
Clarke, “From Information to Cognition: The Systems Counterculture, Heinz von Foerster’s Pedagogy, and Second-Order Cybernetics”

materials.name: Von Foerster, “On Self-Organizing Systems and Their Environments”

title: Self-Reference and Biological Autonomy: Francisco Varela
description: After autopoiesis: Francisco Varela’s cybernetic harvest among the Cybernetic Countercultures.

readings.name: Varela, Principles of Biological Autonomy
Varela, “The Creative Circle: Sketches on the Natural History of Circularity”

materials.name: Varela with Barbara Johnson: “On Observing Natural Systems” (Summer 1976)

title: Planetary Cognition: James Lovelock and Lynn Margulis
description: A maverick scientific collaboration drops into the Cybernetic Countercultures on their way to changing the world.

readings.name: Lovelock, “Cybernetics”
Margulis and Lovelock, “Biological Modulation of the Earth’s Atmosphere”

materials.name: Margulis and Lovelock, “The Atmosphere as Circulatory System of the Biosphere — The Gaia Hypothesis”

title: Neocybernetics and Gaia: Bruce Clarke
description: Lynn Margulis brings planetary autopoiesis to her paradigm-shifting work on symbiosis.

readings.name: Margulis, “Big Trouble in Biology”
Clarke, “Evolutionary Equality”

materials.name: Clarke, Gaian Systems, selections: Chapter 3, “Neocybernetics of Gaia”, Chapter 6, “Margulis and Autopoiesis”

title: Life and Mind: selections from William Irwin Thompson, ed.,
description: The 1981 Lindisfarne Fellows meeting at Green Gulch Zen Center as a reunion of the Cybernetic Countercultures. Emergent recognitions of Gaian cognition.

readings.name: Froese and Ziemke, “Enactive Artificial Intelligence: Investigating the Systemic Organization of Life and Mind”
Gaia 2, Emergence: The New Science of Becoming
Varela, Thompson, and Rosch, The Embodied Mind

materials.name: Gaia, A Way of Knowing: Political Implications of the New Biology

title: Project Roundtable
description: Intensive participants will present the project concepts they have developed throughout the course.
